Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can identify and draw different habitats, such as a playground, garden, forest, parking lot, pond, stream, or lake.
The student can draw and label various plants found in each habitat, like trees, grasses, bushes, or flowering plants.
The student can draw and label various animals found in each habitat, such as lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, or clams.
The student can compare the diversity of plants and animals by including different types that exist in each habitat.
The student can represent patterns by showing similar and different plants and animals across different habitats.
